channel.title: Pentecost on Sermon Archives
channel.description: Recent content in Pentecost on Sermon Archives

item.title: Blessed Are They
item.description: Here is a digital sermon that was found on a 3.5 inch floppy disk. It was converted from an ancient WordPerfect format to PDF.

item.title: A Host Arrayed in White
item.description: This is a handwritten sermon which appears to be from All Saints Day in 1972.

item.title: The Man Who Didn't Care
item.description: This is a 1995 Penecost sermon that I found on a 3.5 inch floppy disc. I was able to convert it to ODT and PDF format.

item.title: The Man Who Didn't Care
item.description: This is a printed and highlighted sermon from 1992 from Pentecost. It is highlighted with yellow higlighter. This is the 150th sermon that I have uploaded to this site.

item.title: Love Builds Bridges
item.description: This is an undated, printed and highlighted sermon that does indicate a date in the church calendar, but not a date. My guess is that it’s from the 1990s given it was printed from a computer.

item.title: Initiative and Finishative
item.description: This is a Pentecost sermon that I may only have in digital form. It was from 1995. The sermon starts by mentioning that his co-pastor, Pastor Apfel, is getting married soon, jokingly mentions some suggestions for possible wedding verses.

item.title: Lord, When Did We See You?
item.description: Here is a typed sermon from 1987 for Christ The King Sunday.

item.title: Christ the King
item.description: This handwritten sermon from 1978 starts with a pretty good joke. It’s written in blue ink with yellow highlighting. This sermon mentions Ascension Lutheran Church of Navarino, WI.

item.title: Thy Kingdom Come
item.description: This is a sermon from 1975 for Christ The King Sunday, handwritten in blue pen and highlighted with red pencil.

item.title: Hints From God
item.description: Here is a handwritten sermon from November of 1975. The sermon was written on green paper in black ink with markings in red ink. It mentions an upcoming Stewardship Sunday.

item.title: For Those in Church
item.description: Here is a Pentecost sermon from 1978, handwritten in blue ink with yellow highlights.

item.title: Something Missing in Religion
item.description: Here is a handwritten sermon from 1975, written in blue ink with highlights in red pencil. It mentions that it is also Stewardship Sunday.

item.title: What We Know
item.description: This is a typed Pentecost sermon from November of 1996. It mentions that he has spent a lot of time waiting recently in waiting rooms and for phone calls. Since it was preached at Emmanuel Lutheran Church in Seymour, the congregation would have been aware of his cancer diagnosis at the time.

item.title: Ready and Waiting
item.description: This is a typed Pentecost sermon from 1993 with yellow highlighting. It was preached on November 14, 1993, likely at Emmanuel Lutheran Church in Seymour, WI.

item.title: Getting Down to Basics
item.description: This sermon is a homecoming of sorts. It was a handwritten sermon that was preached 1978 to the congregation where he grew up!

item.title: For All the Saints
item.description: This sermon is a typed All Saints Day sermon from 1976, with notes and highlights in red.

item.title: This Meal of Hope and Thanks
item.description: This is another example of a “same name, different sermon” sermon. It has the same name as the previous sermon from 1975, but this one is typed and from 1980. There are also notes in light blue ink.

item.title: This Meal of Hope and Thanks
item.description: Here is a handwritten sermon from 1975 for All Saints Day.

item.title: The Givers' Arena
item.description: This is an All Saints Day sermon from 1987. The sermon includes several references, including a very interesting story about a woman that I’ve never heard about before.

item.title: They Is Us
item.description: Here is a handwritten Pentecost sermon from 1975, written in a combination of blue and red ink. A portion of this sermon was crossed out, so it is unclear if that portion was preached.

item.title: All That We Have
item.description: Here is a typed sermon from 1990. It has the same sermon title as the last sermon published, but that one is from 1993. This sermon mentions confirmation, and it is likely the last confirmation class that he preached to in Wausau.

item.title: All That We Have
item.description: Here is a sermon from 1993 that was printed, then highlighted in yellow and marked in red ink. There is a lot of discussion about vineyards, going along with the gospel reading from Matthew 21.

item.title: The Celebration of Holy Communion
item.description: This is an undated sermon from the season of Pentecost. It is partially typed, then marked up and finished in red pen. It is marked up with both normal pencil and blue pencil. My guess is that this sermon comes from the 1970s.

item.title: On Changing Your Mind
item.description: This is an undated sermon from the season of Pentecost. It is partially typed, then finished in pen. It is marked up with both normal pencil and blue pencil.

item.title: Why Won't God Be Fair?
item.description: Here is a typed sermon from 1990. It references the Cubs winning the pennant as an example of unlikely events. It also mentions the baptism of a child that occurred that day.

item.title: Word and Deed
item.description: Here is a sermon that was printed and highlighted in yellow. It was originally preached in Seymour on the 18th Sunday of Pentecost on September 29, 1996.

item.title: Receving With Fear or Faith?
item.description: Here is a typed sermon from 1989 which talks about the end times and using our gifts. The gospel text is listed as Luke 19:26. We are nearing the end of year C in the Revised Common Lectionary!

item.title: The Best and Worst of Times
item.description: This is a typed sermon from 1986 mentioning “Celebration Sunday”. It mentions St. Stephen Lutheran Church by name, which makes sense as he was serving in Wausau at the time.

item.title: Which One Represents You?
item.description: Here is a Pentecost sermon that I have two different copies scanned. One copy is highlighted with yellow highlighter, and a copy that is not highlighted. I also used OCR from Google Docs to get a text version of the sermon.

item.title: Honest to God
item.description: This is a sermon that was printed and highlighted, and preached in 1995. There are red X marks next to two paragraphs in this sermon, so it is possible that those paragraphs were ommitted from the sermon when it was preached. There are also a few handwritten corrections. It was preached at Emmanuel Lutheran Church in Seymour, WI, as the church is mentioned by name in the sermon.

item.title: The Pharisee and the Tax Collector
item.description: This sermon was actually untitled, so I made a title up for this archive. It was a combination of typed and handwritten, and was preached in 1974.

item.title: A World of Widows
item.description: This is a typed sermon with some highlighting and underlining in yellow and red, as well as some corrections in blue pen. It is a sermon from 22 Pentecost and was preached in November of 1989. Technically, Luke 18 is now a part of 19 Pent C in the RCL.

item.title: There Will Be an Answer
item.description: This is a typed sermon with some highlighting and underlining in yellow. It is a sermon from 22 Pentecost and was preached in October of 1986. Technically, Luke 18 is now a part of 19 Pent C in the RCL.

item.title: Prayer Is Friend Talk
item.description: This is an undated, typed sermon with a handwritten closing, as well as some handwritten corrections. I’m going to guess this as coming from 1973? It was originally listed as being from Trinity XXI, but that was crossed out and 22 Pentecost C was written over it. Technically, Luke 18 is now a part of 19 Pent C in the RCL.

item.title: More Than Skin Deep
item.description: This sermon was from 1983 and was scanned from a hand-typed copy, including a variety of notations in red pencil. If I’m keeping track correctly, this is the 75th sermon that I’ve uploaded.

item.title: One Who Says Thanks
item.description: Here is a handwritten sermon, fresh from 1977. The sermon date is noted as 10/23/1977, and the listed Gospel text is Luke 17: 11-19.

item.title: What We Cannot Borrow - St. Stephen Farewell Sermon
item.description: This sermon comes from the farewell service from St. Stephen Lutheran Church in Wausau. Video is available!

item.title: For All the Saints -- For You and Me Too!!
item.description: Here is a typed 1988 All Saints sermon, covering the gospel text from Matthew 5: 1-12.

item.title: When We Mourn
item.description: With All Saints Day coming up, I found a sermon from 1978 about mourning.

item.title: This Love Divine
item.description: It’s a Trinity Sunday sermon about a hymn! Along with the sermon, there are also some hymn descriptions.

item.title: R.S.V.P.
item.description: This is an All Saints Day sermon from 1982. There is a reference to the French meaning of RSVP, but it’s apparent that he’s not a French scholar.

item.title: Remembering And Resembling
item.description: This sermon is from All Saints Day of 1994, and was preached at Carthage College. In addition to the sermon, a scanned copy of the bulletin is included. Marta is listed as the featured soloist in one of the songs.

item.title: God And His Tenants
item.description: This is a handwritten sermon from October of 1978.

item.title: Who's In Charge?
item.description: This is a sermon which has both scanned pages and text available. It was preached in October of 1996.

item.title: It's Not Easy Being A Landlord
item.description: This is a sermon from October of 1996 for the Pentecost season. It appears to be a sermon given around the time of the annual stewardship campaign.

item.title: FOR GRUMBLERS, THE BREAD OF LIFE
item.description: This sermon was preached at Emmanuel Lutheran Church, as a part of a “Polka Service” featuring music by “Jerry Voelker and His Jolly Gents”.
